verses.verse: Now the famine<WH7458> was severe<WH3515> in the land.<WH776>

So it came<WH1961> about when<WH9201> they had finished<WH3615> eating<WH398> the grain<WH7668> which<WH834> they had brought<WH935> from Egypt,<WH4714> that their father said<WH1> to them, "Go<WH559> back,<WH7725> buy<WH7725> us a little<WH7666> food.<WH4592>"

Judah<WH3063> spoke<WH559> to him, however, saying,<WH559> "The man<WH376> solemnly<WH5749> warned<WH5749> us, 'You shall not see<WH7200> my face<WH6440> unless<WH1115> your brother<WH251> is with you.'
"If<WH518> you send<WH7971> our brother<WH251> with us, we will go<WH3381> down<WH3381> and buy<WH7666> you food.<WH400>

"But if<WH518> you do not send<WH7971> [him,] we will not go<WH3381> down;<WH3381> for the man<WH376> said<WH559> to us, 'You shall not see<WH7200> my face<WH6440> unless<WH1115> your brother<WH251> is with you.'"
Then Israel<WH3478> said,<WH559> "Why<WH4100> did you treat<WH7489> me so badly<WH7489> by telling<WH5046> the man<WH376> whether you still<WH5750> had [another] brother<WH251>?"

But they said,<WH559> "The man<WH376> questioned<WH7592> particularly<WH7592> about us and our relatives,<WH4138> saying,<WH559> 'Is your father still<WH1> alive<WH5750>? Have<WH2416> you [another] brother<WH3426>?' So we answered<WH251> his questions.<WH5046> Could we possibly<WH1697> know<WH3045> that he would say,<WH3045> 'Bring<WH559> your brother<WH3381> down<WH251>'?"

And Judah<WH3063> said<WH559> to his father Israel,<WH1> "Send<WH3478> the lad<WH7971> with me, and we will arise<WH5288> and go,<WH6965> that we may live<WH1980> and not die,<WH2421> we as well<WH4191> as you and our little<WH1571> ones.<WH2945>

"I myself<WH595> will be surety<WH6148> for him; you may hold<WH1245> <WH3027> me responsible<WH4480> <WH3027> for him. If<WH518> I do not bring<WH935> him [back] to you and set<WH3322> him before<WH6440> you, then let me bear<WH2398> the blame<WH2398> before you forever.<WH3605> <WH3117>
"For if<WH3884> we had not delayed,<WH4102> surely<WH3588> by now<WH6258> we could have returned<WH7725> twice.<WH6471>"

Then their father Israel<WH1> said<WH3478> to them, "If<WH559> [it must be] so,<WH518> then<WH3651> do<WH645> this:<WH6213> take<WH2088> some<WH3947> of the best<WH4480> products<WH2173> of the land<WH2173> in your bags,<WH776> and carry<WH3627> down<WH3381> to the man<WH3381> as a present,<WH376> a little<WH4503> balm<WH4592> and a little<WH6875> honey,<WH4592> aromatic<WH1706> gum<WH5219> and myrrh,<WH5219> pistachio<WH3910> nuts<WH992> and almonds.<WH992>

"And take<WH3947> double<WH4932> [the] money<WH3701> in your hand,<WH3027> and take<WH7725> back<WH7725> in your hand<WH3027> the money<WH3701> that was returned<WH7725> in the mouth<WH6310> of your sacks;<WH572> perhaps<WH194> it was a mistake.<WH4870>
"Take<WH3947> your brother<WH251> also, and arise,<WH6965> return<WH7725> to the man;<WH376>

and may God<WH410> Almighty<WH7706> grant<WH5414> you compassion<WH7356> in the sight<WH6440> of the man,<WH376> that he may release<WH7971> to you your other<WH312> brother<WH251> and Benjamin.<WH1144> And as for me, if<WH834> I am bereaved<WH7921> of my children,<WH7921> I am bereaved.<WH7921> "

So the men<WH376> took<WH3947> this<WH2088> present,<WH4503> and they took<WH3947> double<WH4932> [the] money<WH3701> in their hand,<WH3027> and Benjamin;<WH1144> then they arose<WH6965> and went<WH3381> down<WH3381> to Egypt<WH4714> and stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> Joseph.<WH3130>

When Joseph<WH3130> saw<WH7200> Benjamin<WH1144> with them, he said<WH559> to his house<WH1004> steward,<WH834> <WH5921> "Bring<WH935> the men<WH376> into the house,<WH1004> and slay<WH2873> [an animal] and make<WH3559> ready;<WH3559> for the men<WH376> are to dine<WH398> with me at noon.<WH6672>"
So the man<WH376> did<WH6213> as Joseph<WH3130> said,<WH559> and brought<WH935> the men<WH376> to Joseph's house.<WH1004>

Now the men<WH376> were afraid,<WH3372> because<WH3588> they were brought<WH935> to Joseph's house;<WH1004> and they said,<WH559> "[It is] because<WH5921> <WH1697> of the money<WH3701> that was returned<WH7725> in our sacks<WH572> the first<WH8462> time<WH8462> that we are being brought<WH935> in, that he may seek<WH1556> occasion<WH1556> against<WH5921> us and fall<WH5307> upon us, and take<WH3947> us for slaves<WH5650> with our donkeys.<WH2543>"
So they came<WH5066> near<WH5066> to Joseph's house<WH1004> steward<WH376>,<WH834> <WH5921> and spoke<WH1696> to him at the entrance<WH6607> of the house,<WH1004>
and said,<WH559> "Oh,<WH994> my lord,<WH113> we indeed<WH3381> came<WH3381> down<WH3381> the first<WH8462> time<WH8462> to buy<WH7666> food,<WH400>

and it came<WH1961> about when<WH3588> we came<WH935> to the lodging<WH4411> place,<WH4411> that we opened<WH6605> our sacks,<WH572> and behold,<WH2009> each<WH376> man's money<WH3701> was in the mouth<WH6310> of his sack,<WH572> our money<WH3701> in full.<WH4948> So we have brought<WH7725> it back<WH7725> in our hand.<WH3027>

"We have also brought<WH3381> down<WH3381> other<WH312> money<WH3701> in our hand<WH3027> to buy<WH7666> food;<WH400> we do not know<WH3045> who<WH4310> put<WH7760> our money<WH3701> in our sacks.<WH572>"

And he said,<WH559> "Be at ease,<WH7965> do not be afraid.<WH3372> Your God<WH430> and the God<WH430> of your father has given<WH1> you treasure<WH5414> in your sacks;<WH4301> I had<WH572> your money.<WH935>" Then he brought<WH3701> Simeon<WH3318> out to them.

Then the man<WH376> brought<WH935> the men<WH376> into Joseph's house<WH1004> and gave<WH5414> them water,<WH4325> and they washed<WH7364> their feet;<WH7272> and he gave<WH5414> their donkeys<WH2543> fodder.<WH4554>
So they prepared<WH3559> the present<WH4503> for Joseph's coming<WH935> at noon;<WH6672> for they had heard<WH8085> that they were to eat<WH398> a meal<WH3899> there.<WH8033>

When Joseph<WH3130> came<WH935> home,<WH1004> they brought<WH935> into the house<WH1004> to him the present<WH4503> which<WH834> was in their hand<WH3027> and bowed<WH7812> to the ground<WH776> before him.
Then he asked<WH7592> them about their welfare,<WH7965> and said,<WH559> "Is your old<WH2205> father well,<WH1> of whom<WH7965> you spoke<WH834>? Is he still<WH559> alive<WH5750>?"
And they said,<WH559> "Your servant<WH5650> our father is well;<WH1> he is still<WH7965> alive.<WH5750>" And they bowed<WH2416> down<WH6915> in homage.<WH7812>

As he lifted<WH5375> his eyes<WH5869> and saw<WH7200> his brother<WH251> Benjamin,<WH1144> his mother's son,<WH1121> he said,<WH559> "Is this<WH2088> your youngest<WH9512> brother,<WH251> of whom<WH834> you spoke<WH559> to me?" And he said,<WH559> "May God<WH430> be gracious<WH2603> to you, my son.<WH1121>"

And Joseph<WH3130> hurried<WH4116> [out] for he was deeply<WH7356> stirred<WH3648> over<WH413> his brother,<WH251> and he sought<WH1245> [a place] to weep;<WH1058> and he entered<WH935> his chamber<WH2315> and wept<WH1058> there.<WH8033>
Then he washed<WH7364> his face,<WH6440> and came<WH3318> out; and he controlled<WH662> himself and said,<WH559> "Serve<WH7760> the meal.<WH3899>"

So they served<WH7760> him by himself,<WH905> and them by themselves,<WH905> and the Egyptians,<WH4713> who ate<WH398> with him, by themselves;<WH905> because<WH3588> the Egyptians<WH4713> could<WH3201> not eat<WH398> bread<WH3899> with the Hebrews,<WH5680> for that is loathsome<WH8441> to the Egyptians.<WH4714>

Now they were seated<WH3427> before<WH6440> him, the first-born according to his birthright<WH1062> and the youngest<WH6810> according to his youth,<WH6812> and the men<WH376> looked<WH8539> at one<WH376> another<WH7453> in astonishment.<WH8539>

And he took<WH5375> portions<WH4864> to them from his own table;<WH6440> but Benjamin's portion<WH4864> was five<WH2568> times<WH3027> as much<WH7235> as any<WH3605> of theirs. So they feasted<WH8354> and drank<WH7937> freely<WH7937> with him.
